ratings.comment: Thermo is not an easy class, and I lost myself in thermo until the week before second exam. Lectures are very organized although Rzchowski tends to review previous lectures and repeat himself a lot. He is also super nice helping students during office hours. Very recommended.

This is my first solid-state physics class, and I think professor Rzchowski did a very good job covering the materials. His lectures were clear, lecture notes were self-contained, the homework was quite easy once you have put some thoughts, and the tests were reasonable in difficulty.
If you know you're not good at physics, go to lectures. He offers up to 2% extra credit to your final grade for attendance.

Rzchowski is a good lecturer, although I thought the textbook was necessary as a supplement. He provides a lot of practice exams so take advantage of that when studying. Extremely generous curve on exams, and there's extra credit. With some consistent work and studying, this class shouldn't be too bad.

Mark does extremely well in explaining difficult subject matter. There aren't a ton of great physics professors so taking him is a no-brainer if you get the chance. Supplies students with helpful resources and is very organized. Overall a great instructor

Most exams were difficult (average 65%), but the professor sets extremely generous letter grade boundaries. The TAs are nice about awarding partial credit on exams. The lectures are fairly straight forward, and the professor takes the time to work through examples in class. Easily approachable & always willing to help! iClicker  extra credit!!
Quite unclear and never lectured fast enough to cover content for the exams

I thought he was a great professor.  I am terrible at physics, but thought that the material and the way he taught it was easier to understand than 207.  Definitely take it with him, it's a lot of work to understand sometimes but there are a lot of resources for help.  Each exam only has 4 questions, so make sure you use old exams as a resource.

Mark is the most organized professor I've ever met. He teaches from lecture slides so be sure to print those out before hand, or you won't get everything down. Lectures can sometimes get confusing but physics is hard, and overall he does a great job making physics more approachable. Tests are pretty tough - do the practice exams!

The work level is about the same as for 207, so expect masteringphysics and labs. Labs always finished early. We had group work for each discussion, which I personally didn't find helpful - but I feel that's more due to issues been my TA and I. Prof. was clear during lecture, worked out problems and was  easy to meet with when I needed to.

Homework and overall workload is not much compared to other 5 credit courses. The tests are by far the hardest thing in the course, but the curve makes it better. Do the practice tests and make the most of the note sheets by putting old problems on there.

I really enjoyed this class. It wasn't easy but if you put in the time it's more than doable. Take the practice exams, do the homework and quizzes and go to lecture you should be fine. I also found the textbook really helpful, there are some great worked through problems in there.

Mark is really nice and meeting with him in person is really refreshing. I had a BC when I met with him and ended up pulling out an AB in the class. He doesnt explain concepts very well in my opinion, and I had to use youtube to explain some concepts. However, he is incredibly organized (breath of fresh air for physics). DO THE PRACTICE EXAMS!

The exams are pretty hard, but he curves them so it doesn't end up being too bad. Lecture didn't make sense a lot of the time (unless you printed out the lecture slides), so going to discussion is pretty necessary.
Best professor for 207208. Class not too difficult if you put in some time. Tons of practice material.

Mark is one of the clearest lecturers I've had, and not just in physics, but compared to all the classes I've taken. His exams are challenging yet fair and he also gives lots of office hours for extra help. Do lots of homework problems and participate in lecture with the clicker questions and you'll do well.
Great Lecturer. Sometimes humorous.
Great Proffesor, tough material, do the practice tests and you will be more than fine
Very good when it comes to physics profs.

Exams were straight forward and similar to previous exams. Full sheet of paper, front and back, used for equations and examples on exams. There is a curve. I got a BC on one of the three exams and on the final and still got an AB. Small amount of extra credit for answering clicker questions in xlass
Mark Rzchowski is a wonderful professor. Take him!
Super
He was an absolutely amazing professor, one of the best I've had at UW!! Physics is hard, but Professor R made it so much better. TAKE HIM!!!

Dr. Rzchowski is a great lecturer - he explains everything very clearly and provides challenging, but interesting examples. He also tries to incorporate as many applications as possible. He also drops by lab and gives helpful feedback. A great prof!

Explains pertinent information fairly well during lecture, but can sometimes require supplementary reading.  Exam questions are challenging word-problems, so be sure to check out practice exams, and I recommend taking a minute to think before attempting to answer questions!

Physics is hard, he helped make it easier.  People say you can skip lecture if you actually read, but it'll make your life harder.  It is worthwhile for the difficulty of these exams to do the readings AND go to lecture... you will feel great though when you finally leave that final exam and can put physics behind you.
Best biology professor I've had in a while.

He was great!  Laid back and fun, shows up in the lab sections and answers questions, will stick with you and show you even more than the lab is designed for to really help you understand what's going on.  He wants you to understand the answer to your question, not just get the answer.
A helpful professor.  He speaks awkwardly, but you get used to it.  In general a good professor.

Not that there's any choice of profs but Rzchow was pretty good for physics. In the long run reading ended up replacing class and my grade went way up. Not necessarily his fault though. Can't say as much for his co-professor Montarouli she's absolutely dreadful.
Does some good demonstrations and is interesting. He sometimes talks waaay too fast though.

Papers are set in a way such that the grade you get reflects the amount of your REAL understanding. An interesting and responsible professor; he'll tell you more if you express interest. Turns up in labs and helps TAs answer questions. I'll definitely recommend him if you must take this course.
No Comments

Nice guy, will help with questions. Does not teach anything on the tests or homework. Just talks about practical application and very limited theory. Expects you to be able to do complex problems without seeing any examples.
Got more out of reading the textbook, hard to stay awake. His slides are helpful though, and the class is easy and interesting at times
Not a very good professor...like to curve your grade...in a DOWNWARD direction
